name: Pathétique - Songs from the Heart

location.name: George Weston Recital Hall, Meridian Arts Centre

description:
Enjoy a wonderfully varied program of music from three eras and four places - Canada, England, France and Vienna. 

Maestro Arman leads the orchestra in Elgar's lyrical Serenade, the world premiere of a folk-inspired Sinfonietta by Montreal composer Petros Shoujounian. This will be the first performance of Toronto composer Colin Eatock's beautiful settings of poems by Bengali literary icon Rabindranath Tagore, a famous Romantic solo violin showpiece and a lush orchestral version of Beethoven's famous Pathétique sonata. Two exciting young Canadian soloists will be presented - soprano Kripa Nageshwar will perform the Eatock songs, and violinist Evan Pyne will appear in Saint-Saëns' brilliant Romantic virtuoso show-stopper, the Introduction and Rondo Capriccioso.

name: Danish String Quartet

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Established its pre-eminence among the world's finest string quartets with its impeccable musicianship, sophisticated artistry, and, above all, an unmatched ability to play as one. Their performances are characterized by a rare musical spontaneity, giving audiences the sense of hearing even treasured canon repertoire as if for the first time. 

Described by the Washington Post as "...one of the best quartets before the public today", enjoy a delightful program of Alfred Schnittke: String Quartet No. 2, Jonny Greenwood: Suite from the film "There Will Be Blood", and Maurice Ravel: String Quartet in F Major.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.

name: Flamenco Saturday
description: Flamenco has been a staple for the last seven years! Come enjoy the promise of an evening of intense, emotional vocals, guitar and percussion with mesmerizing dance and intricate percussive footwork.
